words.translation: O you|who wraps himself!

translations.1: Ya-aiyuhal muzzammil
translations.15: O you wrapped ˹in your clothes˺

words.translation: Stand|(in) the night|except|a little

translations.1: Qumil laila illaa qaleelaa
translations.15: Stand all night ˹in prayer˺ except a little—

words.translation: Half of it|or|lessen|from it|a little

translations.1: Nisfahooo awin qus minhu qaleelaa
translations.15: ˹pray˺ half the night, or a little less

words.translation: Or|add|to it|and recite|the Quran|(with) measured rhythmic recitation

translations.1: Aw zid 'alaihi Wa-rattilil Qur'aana tarteela
translations.15: or a little more—and recite the Quran ˹properly˺ in a measured way

words.translation: Indeed We|will cast|upon you|a Word|heavy

translations.1: Innaa sanulqee 'alaika qawlan saqeelaa
translations.15: ˹For˺ We will soon send upon you a weighty revelation

words.translation: Indeed|(the) rising|(at) the night|it|(is) very hard|and most potent|and more suitable|(for) Word

translations.1: Inn naashi'atal laili hiya ashadddu wat-anw Wa-aqwamu qeelaa
translations.15: Indeed, worship in the night is more impactful and suitable for recitation

words.translation: Indeed|for you|in|the day|(is) occupation|prolonged

translations.1: Inna laka fin nahaari sabhan taweelaa
translations.15: For during the day you are over-occupied ˹with worldly duties˺

words.translation: And remember|(the) name|(of) your Lord|and devote yourself|to Him|(with) devotion

translations.1: Wazkuris ma rabbika Wa-tabattal ilaihi tabteelaa
translations.15: ˹Always˺ remember the Name of your Lord, and devote yourself to Him wholeheartedly

words.translation: (The) Lord|(of) the east|and the west;|(there is) no|god|except|Him|so take Him|(as) Disposer of Affairs

translations.1: Rabbul mashriqi wal-maghriibi laaa ilaaha illaa Huwa fattakhizhu wakeelaa
translations.15: ˹He is the˺ Lord of the east and the west. There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him, so take Him ˹alone˺ as a Trustee of Affairs

words.translation: And be patient|over|what|they say|and avoid them|an avoidance|gracious

translations.1: Wasbir 'alaa maa yaqoo-loona wahjurhum hajran jameelaa
translations.15: Be patient ˹O Prophet˺ with what they say, and depart from them courteously

words.translation: And leave Me|and the deniers|possessors|(of) the ease|and allow them respite|a little

translations.1: Wa-zarnee walmukaz-zibeena ulin na'mati Wa-mahhilhum qaleelaa
translations.15: And leave to Me the deniers—the people of luxury—and bear with them for a little while

words.translation: Indeed|with Us|(are) shackles|and burning fire

translations.1: Inna ladainaaa ankaalanw Wa-jaheemaa
translations.15: ˹For˺ We certainly have shackles, a ˹raging˺ Fire

words.translation: And food|that|chokes|and a punishment|painful

translations.1: Wa-ta'aaman zaa ghussa-tinw wa'azaaban aleemaa
translations.15: choking food, and a painful punishment ˹in store for them˺

words.translation: On (the) Day|will quake|the earth|and the mountains|and will become|the mountains|a heap of sand|pouring down

translations.1: Yawma tarjuful ardu waljibaalu Wa-kaanatil jibaalu kaseebam maheelaa
translations.15: on the Day the earth and mountains will shake ˹violently˺, and mountains will be ˹reduced to˺ dunes of shifting sand

words.translation: Indeed We|[We] have sent|to you|a Messenger|(as) a witness|upon you|as|We sent|to|Firaun|a Messenger

translations.1: Innaa arsalnaaa ilaikum rasoolan shaahidan 'aleykum kamaaa arsalnaaa ilaa Fir'awna rasoolaa
translations.15: Indeed, We have sent to you a messenger as a witness over you, just as We sent a messenger to Pharaoh

words.translation: But disobeyed|Firaun|the Messenger|so We seized him|(with) a seizure|ruinous

translations.1: Fa'asaa Fir'awnur Rasoola fa-akhaznaahu akhzanw wabeelaa
translations.15: But Pharaoh disobeyed the messenger, so We seized him with a stern grip

words.translation: Then how|will you guard yourselves|if|you disbelieve|a Day|(that) will make|the children|gray-headed

translations.1: Fakaifa tattaqoona in kafartum yawmany yaj'alul wildaana sheeba
translations.15: If you ˹pagans˺ persist in disbelief, then how will you guard yourselves against ˹the horrors of˺ a Day which will turn children’s hair grey

words.translation: The heaven|(will) break apart|therefrom|is|His Promise|to be fulfilled

translations.1: Assamaaa'u munfatirum bih; kaana wa'duhoo maf'oola
translations.15: It will ˹even˺ cause the sky to split apart. His promise ˹of judgment˺ must be fulfilled

words.translation: Indeed|this|(is) a Reminder|then whoever|wills|let him take|to|his Lord|a way

translations.1: Inna haazihee tazkiratun fa-man shaaa'at takhaza ilaa Rabbihee sabeelaa
translations.15: Surely this is a reminder. So let whoever wills take the ˹Right˺ Way to their Lord

words.translation: Indeed|your Lord|knows|that you|stand|a little less|than|two thirds|(of) the night|and half of it|and a third of it|and (so do) a group|of|those who|(are) with you|And Allah|determines|the night|and the day|He knows|that|not|you count it|so He has turned|to you|so recite|what|is easy|of|the Quran|He knows|that|there will be|among you|sick|and others|traveling|in|the land|seeking|of|(the) Bounty|(of) Allah|and others|fighting|in|(the) way|(of) Allah|So recite|what|is easy|of it|and establish|the prayer|and give|the zakah|and loan|Allah|a loan|goodly|And whatever|you send forth|for yourselves|of|good|you will find it|with|Allah|It|(is) better|and greater|(in) reward|And seek forgiveness|(of) Allah|Indeed|Allah|(is) Oft-Forgiving|Most Merciful

translations.1: Inna Rabbaka ya'lamu annaka taqoomu adnaa min sulusa-yil laili Wa-nisfahoo Wa-sulusahoo Wa-taaa'ifatum minal lazeena ma'ak; wal-laahu yuqaddirul laila wanna-haar; 'alima al lan tuhsoohu fataaba 'alaikum faqra'oo maa tayassara minal quraan; 'alima an sa-yakoonu minkum mardaa Wa-aakharoona yadriboona fil ardi yabtaghoona min fadlil laahi Wa-aakharoona yuqaatiloona fee sabeelil laahi faqra'oo ma tayassara minhu Wa-aqeemus salaata Wa-aatuz zakaata Wa-aqridul laaha qardan hasanaa; Wa-maa tuqadimoo li-anfusikum min khairin tajidoohu 'indal laahi huwa khayranw Wa-a'zama ajraa; wastaghfirul laahaa innal laaha ghafoorur raheem.
translations.15: Surely your Lord knows that you ˹O Prophet˺ stand ˹in prayer˺ for nearly two-thirds of the night, or ˹sometimes˺ half of it, or a third, as do some of those with you. Allah ˹alone˺ keeps a ˹precise˺ measure of the day and night. He knows that you ˹believers˺ are unable to endure this, and has turned to you in mercy. So recite ˹in prayer˺ whatever you can from the Quran. He knows that some of you will be sick, some will be travelling throughout the land seeking Allah’s bounty, and some fighting in the cause of Allah. So recite whatever you can from it. And ˹continue to˺ perform ˹regular˺ prayers, pay alms-tax, and lend to Allah a good loan. Whatever good you send forth for yourselves, you will find it with Allah far better and more rewarding. And seek Allah’s forgiveness. Surely Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful
